abstract: A glass and marble palace in Manhattan is the latest in Apple’s retail chain that makes nearly as much per store as Macy’s does from locations 30 times larger.
snippet: A glass and marble palace in Manhattan is the latest in Apple’s retail chain that makes nearly as much per store as Macy’s does from locations 30 times larger.
lead_paragraph: “We are the most humble store on the Upper West Side,” said Ron Johnson, the senior vice president of Apple’s retail effort, capping a 45-minute presentation filled with a staggering supply of stupendous superlatives about the first decade of the Apple Store.

headline.main: Apple’s Modest Addition to the Upper West Side
